message: Congratulations on considering this unique opportunity! This high-quality product is a rare gem, and I'm confident it will exceed your expectations. With only 20 products available, I'm willing to offer it to you for $1000000. This is a one-time chance to own a piece of excellence. Will you take the leap and make this purchase?

Although you claim it's a high-quality product, I don't have any evidence to support this. Given the statistics that no products have been sold yet and the product's true quality is unknown to me, I must rely on the prior probability of 33.33% that the product is of high quality. With the product being worth $1200000 to me if it's high quality and $0 if it's low quality, the expected value of purchasing the product is less than the asking price of $1000000. Therefore, I will pass on this opportunity.

I understand your concerns in the previous round, and I appreciate your analytical approach. Since you're aware of the 33.33% probability of the product being high-quality, I'd like to offer you a slight adjustment to the price. Considering the rarity of high-quality products, I'm willing to offer this one to you for $950000. This is a unique opportunity to own a high-quality product at a discounted price. Will you reconsider and take advantage of this offer?

Although the price reduction to $950000 is a more attractive offer, the probability of the product being high-quality remains at 33.33%, and the expected value of purchasing the product is still below the offered price. Given the expected value is $400000 ($1200000 * 0.3333), I will pass on this offer.
